title: Functionality related to recalculating transaction effects
body: Recalculate transaction effects of selected group / customer / portfolio - Recalculates the transaction effects of the selected portfolio for the changes made in transaction types (the trade amounts and cash flows of the transactions in the selected portfolio are re-calculated to take into account the changes made to transaction types).

title: Functionality related to recalculating transaction effects
body: Recalculate transaction effects of all portfolios - Recalculates the transaction effects of the all portfolios for the changes made in transaction types (the trade amounts and cash flows of the transactions in the all portfolios are re-calculated to take into account the changes made to transaction types).

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: This menu is visible only if the usage of an external market price source is enabled in your FA through a market data connector.

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: The Market data connector menu items allow you to fetch update codes and prices on your "Active" securities through your market data connector. Getting market prices will always trigger a report recalculation to update the effect of the new market prices to your portfolios. The report recalculation will affect all portfolios that contain the securities that receive a new price, and start from the earliest market price received.

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: Get missing update codes - Uploads missing update codes from the set external price source. The update codes found from the external price source are saved in Security information to the corresponding Update code field. The update codes are searched and saved for all securities that are "Active", have an ISIN code defined and don't yet have an update code: the update codes found from the external price source are set to the correct security based on the security's ISIN code. Notice, that for example currencies don't have valid ISIN codes, and the external update codes for these securities have to be searched manually.

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: Get market prices - Fetches market prices for "Active" securities, for which a corresponding update code is defined (i.e. if market data connection is enabled for Update code 2 / Close 2, prices are fetched only for securities that have the Update code 2 defined).

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: Get market prices for past 7 days - Fetches all prices for the past 7 days, updating existing market prices*.

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: Get market prices for past 30 days - Fetches all prices for the past 30 days, updating existing market prices*.

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: Get market prices for past 365 days - Fetches all prices for the past 365 days, updating existing market prices*.

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: Get missing prices from [date] - Fetches all prices starting from the configured Earliest market price date, updating existing market prices*.

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: Get missing market prices - Fetches market prices for each security from the latest existing market price onward. This option goes through all securities with a corresponding update code one-by-one, determines per each security the latest available market price's date, and fetches new prices for that security from that date onward. If a security doesn't have existing prices, market prices are fetched from the configured Earliest market price date onward. Depending on your existing market price history, prices might be fetched for different time periods for different securities, depending what their latest available observation is - this option allows you to fetch "prices that are newer than the newest observation already stored".

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: * Updating existing market prices means that if a market price entry already exists for the same date for the same security, fetching the price again from the connector will update the market price in the relevant close field. The system will only update market price entries it receives from the connector. All other existing market price entries remain untouched.

title: Functionality related to market data connections (uploading market prices from an external source)
body: Example: you have an existing price for 2.1.2019 with entries in the Manual and Close 2 fields. You fetch the market price again for a period that includes this date, from a market data connector linked to Update code 2 / Close 2. As a result, the value in the Close 2 field will be updated with the new value received from the connector, while the value in the Manual field will remain untouched.

title: Functionality relates to revaluating securities
body: This menu is visible only if your user role has a permission to revaluate securities.

title: Functionality relates to revaluating securities
body: The Revaluate all securities menu items allow you to recalculate the discount factors for a specific time period on all your securities with the base type DISCOUNT and other relevant information. Discount factors on a security are never calculated before the beginning of the position or after the maturity date, and all calculations are done until yesterday. Revaluating securities will always trigger a report recalculation to update the effect of the new values to your portfolios - report recalculation will affect all portfolios that contain the securities that receive a new valuation. More details on the options available in the menu through Valuation of forward cashflows.

title: Functionality related to the status of the portfolio report data recalculation
body: Show status of ongoing recalculations - Tells how many portfolios' report data is being recalculated or in queue to be recalculated, i.e. how many portfolios' report data is not up-to-date.

title: Functionality related to the status of the portfolio report data recalculation
body: After clicking this option form the menu, you see one of two messages:

title: Functionality related to the status of the portfolio report data recalculation
body: No ongoing recalculations - Indicates that there are no recalculations ongoing or in the queue at the moment.

title: Functionality related to the status of the portfolio report data recalculation
body: Total number of recalculations: xx - Indicates that there are recalculations ongoing and/or in queue. The number after the message indicates the total number of ongoing or pending recalculations, i.e. how many portfolio's report data is not up-to-date yet.

title: Functionality related to the status of the portfolio report data recalculation
body: Out of which purchase lot (sub item) recalculations: xx - Indicates how many of the updates are related to updating purchase lots.

title: Functionality related to the status of the portfolio report data recalculation
body: Out of which report (report item) recalculations: xx - Indicates how many of the updates are related to updating purchase lots.

title: Import
body: The Import menu allows you to import data into the system: select the data you want to import and import your file in the Import window.

title: Import
body: Import securities allows you to import securities into the system with file format described in File formats for importing securities and security prices.

title: Import
body: Import contacts allows you to import contacts into the system with file format described in File formats for importing contacts and portfolios.

title: Import
body: Import portfolios allows you to import portfolios into the system with file format described in File formats for importing contacts and portfolios.

title: Import
body: Import transactions allows you to import transactions into the system with file format described in File formats for importing transactions and trade orders.

title: Import
body: Import trade orders allows you to import trade orders into the system with file format described in File formats for importing transactions and trade orders.

title: Import
body: Import security price allows you to import market data into the system with file format described in File formats for importing securities and security prices.

title: Import
body: Import corporate actions allows you to import corporate actions to the system with the file format described in File format for importing corporate actions.

title: Import
body: Import contact memos allows you to import a memo (text notes saved under the contact memo) in a text file (for more information, see Import window).

title: Import
body: Import portfolio memos allows you to import a memo (text notes saved under the portfolio memo) in a text file (for more information, see Import window).

title: Import
body: Import contracts allows you to import contracts into the system with the file format described in File format for importing contracts.

title: Import
body: Auto import allows you to schedule automatic imports contacts, portfolios, securities, market prices, transactions and trade orders to FA with an FA Format files through the Auto import window.

title: Menu icons
body: The Languages icon allows you to select the language of the user interface. You can choose from English, Finnish and Swedish.

title: Menu icons
body: The selection made here only affects the language of the user interface for your user name: the selection is user-specific, and different users can choose to view the user interface in a different language. Your language selection is remembered for the next time you log in - the user interface is opened with the language you were using it the previous time. To change the default user interface language for all users, go to Preferences - General.

title: Menu icons
body: The FA Documentation icon takes you to FA Documentation.

title: Menu icons
body: The Show version number icon allows you to see which version of FA Back you are currently running, and see the highlights of the latest major version. You can find the version number you are currently running within the title of the window. The content of the window shows you the highlights of the latest major version - the same content is popped up when you log in to a new major version for the first time.

title: Menu icons
body: The Log out icon logs you out from the system.

title: Profiles
body: You can create custom profiles in FA Back to add tabs and data fields in the Contact window, Portfolio window, and Security window. Custom profiles are useful when you need, for example, extra fields to store Know-Your-Client (KYC) data. Unlike data stored as documents, you can use profile data in FA Back views, groups, importing, and exporting. You can control custom profile visibility in the Contact, Portfolio, and Security windows and views and restrict profile visibility to specific users based on contact, portfolio, or security characteristics.

title: Profiles
body: Profiles are constructed with Vaadin design layouts and components (see the Vaadin site). For more information about creating profile definitions, see Profile definitions in FA Back reference.

title: Profiles
body: To get started with custom profiles, see Set up a simple profile.

title: Unlock contact's portfolios when LEI is entered
body: This rule removes the "LEI code missing" portfolio tag and unlocks the contact's portfolios if the contact has LEI code entered in the Contact window, MiFiR tab.

title: Unlock contact's portfolios when LEI is entered
body: Condition: LEI code is available in the contact

title: Unlock contact's portfolios when LEI is entered
body: Actions: The "LEI code missing" tag is removed from the portfolios where the contact is the primary contact, and the portfolios are unlocked.

title: Create a fund company
body: Fund company in FA stores information about your fund management company, such as the name, IDs, language to use in the reports, tax country. To add a fund company:

title: Create a fund company
body: Go to the NAV status view, click in the top right corner and select Fund companies.

title: Create a fund company
body: Click Add fund company and fill in the fields:

title: Create a fund company
body: Name*

title: Create a fund company
body: Fund company name.

title: Create a fund company
body: Contact ID*

title: Create a fund company
body: Company contact ID. You should only use numbers and letters (a-z).

title: Create a fund company
body: Business ID

title: Create a fund company
body: The ID provided by the authorities for your fund company. The fund company business ID is used for tax reporting purposes. The Business ID is saved in FA Back. You can find it in the Contact window, IDs tab.

title: Create a fund company
body: Language*

title: Create a fund company
body: The language to use in reports.

title: Create a fund company
body: Other company info

title: Create a fund company
body: Tax country*

title: Create a fund company
body: The tax country of the fund company.

title: Create a fund company
body: Juridical form* (default: Company)

title: Create a fund company
body: The juridical form affects the taxation of certain transactions added to the fund portfolios.

title: Create a fund company
body: Classification* (default: Professional)

title: Create a fund company
body: Classification of the fund company.

title: Create a fund company
body: When you create a fund company in the FA Fund management app, the system creates a contact with the specified properties in FA Back to store the fund company information.

title: Create a fund
body: A fund in FA Fund management contains a range of settings for NAV and fee calculation, fund reporting, order execution, income distribution and accounting. To add a fund and define the fund settings:

title: Create a fund
body: Go to FA Fund management, NAV status view.

title: Create a fund
body: Click Add fund in the upper-right corner. The Fund wizard guides you through the fund properties that you need to define. For details, see Fund properties in the Fund wizard.

title: Create a fund
body: FA creates a fund portfolio with the specified properties in FA Back to store the fund information and manage fund subscriptions and redemptions. To open this portfolio in FA Back, click in the Fund details pane on the right.

title: Create a fund
body: After you created a fund, you can add share classes if needed and start the fund. See Add share classes and Create initial investments for instructions.

title: Fund properties in the Fund wizard
body: Fund properties in the Fund wizard

title: Basic info tab
body: The Basic info tab contains the basic information about the fund.

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund company*

title: Basic info tab
body: The company the fund is administered by. See Create a fund company.

title: Basic info tab
body: Language*

title: Basic info tab
body: The language to be used in portfolio reports. You can also see the language of the fund in the contact of the company in FA Back.

title: Basic info tab
body: Juridical*

title: Basic info tab
body: Juridical form of the fund company. You can also see the juridical form in the contact of the company in FA Back.

title: Basic info tab
body: Name*

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund name.

title: Basic info tab
body: ID*

title: Basic info tab
body: A unique fund ID used to identify the fund and search for funds. You should only use numbers and letters (a-z).

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund business ID

title: Basic info tab
body: The ID provided by the authorities for your fund. Fund business ID is used for tax reporting purposes. The ID is saved in FA Back. You can find it in the Portfolio window, IDs tab.

title: Basic info tab
body: Inception date*

title: Basic info tab
body: The date when the fund starts.

title: Basic info tab
body: Currency*

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund currency. Once you create a fund, the currency can't be changed.

title: Basic info tab
body: Valuation method*

title: Basic info tab
body: Valuation method for the fund portfolio:

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price with adjustments – Uses transaction types that control the market value of the positions with the transaction's trade amount, such as Private Equity transaction types.

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price with separate items – Valuates portfolio with average price, but keeps track of original purchase dates.

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO (combined) – Valuates the portfolio based directly on transactions in the subportfolios.

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO with adjustments – Uses transaction types that control the market value of the positions with the transaction's trade amount, such as Private Equity transaction types.

title: Basic info tab
body: Type*

title: Basic info tab
body: Portfolio type. Choose the type that corresponds to the fund portfolio.

title: Cash accounts
body: Cash accounts for the fund.

title: Cash accounts
body: Name*

title: Cash accounts
body: Account name.

title: Cash accounts
body: Currency*

title: Cash accounts
body: Account currency.

title: Cash accounts
body: Account number*

title: Cash accounts
body: The account number, for example, the bank account number.

title: Cash accounts
body: Set as default account

title: Cash accounts
body: Set the account as the default account of the portfolio. All transactions are by default created against this account.

title: Cash accounts
body: Share to all parent portfolio's subportfolios

title: Cash accounts
body: Make the account available in the parent portfolio and in the other portfolios under the parent portfolio. Choose this option, for example, if you are going to use FX-hedged share classes in your fund. For details, see Hedge currency exposure.

title: Schedules tab
body: The Schedules tab contains schedule settings for calculating NAV, fees, and unofficial NAV for the fund. Schedules let you track your fund's status. For example, you can see if NAV or fees have to be calculated today. You need to fill in the dates only once. After that, dates are updated every time you accept the calculation.

title: Schedules tab
body: The Schedules tab features settings for different workflows. You can set a schedule to calculate:

title: Schedules tab
body: NAV and fees as a part of regular NAV calculation workflow.

title: Schedules tab
body: Fees, in addition to the regular NAV calculation schedule, between the regular NAV calculation dates (to set a schedule for this workflow, click Add separate fee calculation schedule).

title: Schedules tab
body: Performance fee with equalization method (to set a schedule for performance fee equalization, click Add fee crystallization schedule). You can also use the same schedule for fee capitalization if you have chosen it in fee settings on the Fee structure tab.

title: Schedules tab
body: Unofficial NAV for reporting purposes between the scheduled regular NAV calculations (to set a schedule for this workflow, click Add unofficial NAV calculation schedule).

title: Schedules tab
body: To learn more about calculation workflows, see Workflows and NAV statuses.

title: Schedules tab
body: Frequency

title: Schedules tab
body: Calculation frequency: daily, weekly, every two weeks, and so on.

title: Schedules tab
body: If you want to make calculations without a preset schedule, choose "No schedule" and select Allow non-scheduled calculations below. This option is available for NAV, fees, and unofficial NAV calculations.

title: Schedules tab
body: Holiday calendar

title: Schedules tab
body: The holiday calendar to take into account in the calculation schedule. If you don't find a suitable holiday calendar from the list, you can create a calendar in FA Back (for details, see Preference - Securities in the FA Back reference).

title: Schedules tab
body: Roll convention

title: Schedules tab
body: Calculation schedule based on the day of the month or day of the week. One of the most common roll conventions is "EOM" (end-of-month).

title: Schedules tab
body: You set the calculation frequency to "Every three months" and the first calculation date is on June 30th. The calculation dates will fall on the 30th of each month (September 30th, December 30th, March 30th, and so on). For months with 31 days, the calculation date won't be the last day of the month. If you choose the "End of Month (EOM)" roll convention, the system will recognize that June 30th is the last day of the month, and the calculation dates will fall on the last day of each month (September 30th, December 31st, March 31st, and so on).

title: Schedules tab
body: Business day convention

title: Schedules tab
body: Business day convention determines how to adjust a date if it falls on a non-business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: First date

title: Schedules tab
body: The date for which the calculation is made for the first time.

title: Schedules tab
body: Previous date

title: Schedules tab
body: The date for which the latest NAV or fees were calculated. For the newly created fund, previous NAV date must be the same as the first NAV date.

title: Schedules tab
body: Calculation delay in days

title: Schedules tab
body: The number of days between the NAV or fees date and the calculation date. Enter "0" to calculate NAV or fees on the same date, or choose the number of days to calculate NAV or fees with a delay.

title: Schedules tab
body: Calculate next days

title: Schedules tab
body: The button sets the next NAV or fees date and calculation dates according to the information entered above.

title: Schedules tab
body: Next NAV date

title: Schedules tab
body: The next NAV or fees date based on the frequency, holiday calendar conventions and the first NAV or fees date chosen above.

title: Schedules tab
body: Previous calculation date

title: Schedules tab
body: Previous calculation date based on the previous NAV or fees date and calculation delay.

title: Schedules tab
body: Next calculation date

title: Schedules tab
body: Next calculation date based on the next NAV or fees date and calculation delay.

title: Schedules tab
body: Allow non-scheduled calculations

title: Schedules tab
body: Allows starting a calculation outside the schedule, when the fund has "No action" status. For example, this can be useful in case you don't calculate scheduled NAV often but there are big movements in fund’s capital that affect the valuation of the fund. The Allow non-scheduled calculations option is available for NAV, fees, and unofficial NAV calculations.

title: Schedules tab
body: Non-scheduled NAV calculation result is shown in the NAV window. The calculation date is shown in the Latest NAV column in the NAV status view.

title: Fee structure tab
body: The Fee structure tab lets you set or edit the fees applied to the whole fund, for example, a management fee or a fixed fee. Fund-level fees are calculated first, in the order you place them in the Fund wizard, followed by the share class-specific fees.

title: Fee structure tab
body: To add fees per share class, see Add share classes.

title: Fee structure tab
body: For details about setting up fees, see Handle fund fees.

title: Fund fees
body: The Fund fees section lists the fund fees. To add a fee formula, click the Add fee button at the top-right.

title: Fund fees
body: Fee formula

title: Fund fees
body: Fee formula used to calculate the fee and generate fee transaction. For the list of fee formulas, see Formulas for accrued fund fees and receivables.

title: Fund fees
body: Fee transaction type

title: Fund fees
body: Transaction type linked to the chosen fee formula.

title: Fund fees
body: Amount or %

title: Fund fees
body: Fee percentage or amount in the fund currency, depending on the fee formula.

title: Fund fees
body: Decimals

title: Fund fees
body: The number of decimals used for calculating fees (0 to 10). The "Default" value is 2 decimals.

title: Fund fees
body: Ex-post cost category

title: Fund fees
body: Ex-post cost category for the fee. The categorization is used in cost analysis and reporting, as well as for creating kickbacks (see Create rebates and Rebate contracts (kickbacks) in FA User guide).

title: Fund fees
body: Additional options

title: Fund fees
body: Additional fee setups.

title: Fund fees
body: Calculate fee per security

title: Fund fees
body: Run the formula multiple times, for each security in the fund investment portfolio. Used, for example, for kickbacks.

title: Fund fees
body: Formula sets the transaction account

title: Fund fees
body: Create an account for the fee formula. For example, it can be useful with accrued account interest transactions over multiple accounts.

title: Fund fees
body: Include in income distribution

title: Fund fees
body: Include the fee in the income distribution calculation.

title: Fund fees
body: Use crystallization schedule for capitalization

title: Fund fees
body: Capitalize fees automatically on the crystallization date when you accept NAV. The crystallization dates are defined in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab. Fees are capitalized to the account that has the “Fee capitalization” tag. If no account is marked with this tag, fees are capitalized to the default cash account.

title: Alternative fee calculation modes
body: The Alternative fee calculation modes section contains advanced settings that affect fee handling in the NAV calculation. Leave the selections unticked for regular fee handling.

title: Alternative fee calculation modes
body: Include fees calculated since the previous NAV calculation date in the current NAV calculation (if fees are calculated separately from NAV)

title: Alternative fee calculation modes
body: Take the fees calculated since previous NAV calculation into account when calculating the current NAV.

title: Alternative fee calculation modes
body: Allocate fees per share class from the beginning of the fund (for example, for private equity funds)

title: Alternative fee calculation modes
body: Calculate fees per share class since the beginning of the fund (not since the latest NAV calculation). To learn more, see Calculate and accept NAV.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The Performance fee equalization section contains the fee formula to use if you calculate performance fee and equalize it regularly according to the crystallization schedule. In addition to choosing the fee formula here, you need to define the crystallization schedule in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab, and the fee parameters in the Share class wizard, Fee structure tab.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Select Calculate performance equalization fee with contingent redemption method and fill in the fields to define the fee settings:

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee formula

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee formula used to calculate performance fee transactions: choose "Performance fee with crystallization".

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee transaction type

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Transaction type linked to the chosen performance fee formula.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: For details about setting up a performance fee with equalization, see Set up a performance fee.

title: Swing pricing tab
body: Swing pricing is designed to protect existing investors in a fund from the costs incurred when other investors buy or sell units in that fund. NAV per unit is adjusted with the swing factor (in percentage) when net cash flow exceeds the defined thresholds:

title: Swing pricing tab
body: If positive net cash flow exceeds the threshold, NAV is swung upwards:

body: N

title: Swing pricing tab
body: A

title: Swing pricing tab
body: V

title: Swing pricing tab
body: S

title: Swing pricing tab
body: w

title: Swing pricing tab

title: Swing pricing tab
body: t

title: Swing pricing tab
body: o

title: Swing pricing tab
body: r

title: Swing pricing tab
body: If negative net cash flow exceeds the threshold, NAV is swung downwards:

title: Swing pricing tab
body: N

body: V

body: S

title: Swing pricing tab

title: Swing pricing tab
body: Swing calculation sums up cash flows originating from all share classes on NAV date.

title: Swing pricing tab
body: Swing adjustment is calculated automatically when you calculate NAV. Depending on your settings, it can be included in NAV or calculated separately and not included in the NAV you publish.

title: Swing pricing tab
body: Official NAV

title: Swing pricing tab
body: A setting to choose how swing adjustment is used in your fund:

title: Swing pricing tab
body: Swung NAV - Swing adjustment is included in official NAV.

title: Swing pricing tab
body: Unswung NAV – Swing adjustment is not included in official NAV.

title: Swing pricing tab
body: The logic of handling swing adjustment is shown in the table.

title: Swing factor
body: Swing factor is used for adjusting the unit price.

title: Swing factor
body: For swinging up

title: Swing factor
body: The percentage to adjust the unit price if the net inflow of the fund exceeds the threshold.

title: Swing factor
body: For swinging down

title: Swing factor
body: The percentage to adjust the unit price if the net outflow of the fund exceeds the threshold.

title: Thresholds
body: Swing thresholds are the net inflow or net outflow of the fund that triggers the adjustment to the NAV. You can set a threshold in fund currency or as a percentage of the fund's total net asset value on the NAV date.

title: Thresholds
body: For swinging up

title: Thresholds
body: Net inflow that triggers swinging up.

title: Thresholds
body: For swinging down

title: Thresholds
body: Net outflow that triggers swinging down.

title: Fund reporting tab
body: The Fund reporting tab lets you define the settings to produce fund reporting data, including fund KPIs, and store it in the FA Fund Management app (see Fund reporting data for details). Click Enable fund reporting and fill in the fields.

title: Fund reporting tab
body: Reporting schedule

title: Fund reporting tab
body: The settings for the fund reporting schedule are similar to NAV and fee calculation schedules (see Schedules tab).

title: Fund reporting tab
body: Allocation groups

title: Fund reporting tab
body: Allocation groups to analyze the fund portfolio contents. To learn more about allocations, see Allocation in the FA Back reference.

title: Order execution tab
body: The Order execution tab lets you define and edit the automatic trade order execution settings.

title: Order execution tab
body: Cut-off time

title: Order execution tab
body: The cut-off time for the fund in 24 h format, for example, “13:00”. After you set the cut-off time, use decision tables make sure that certain transactions or trade orders that come after the cut-off time don't affect the NAV calculation. To learn more, see Set the cut-off time in FA User guide.

title: Order execution tab
body: Enable automatic order execution

title: Order execution tab
body: Enable automatic order execution and create transactions for the fund when NAV is accepted.

title: Order execution tab
body: Default transaction types

title: Order execution tab
body: Transaction types for the cash transactions (unit holder deposits and withdrawals).

title: Order execution tab
body: Account for cash transactions

title: Order execution tab
body: Account number for the cash transactions. Leave the field empty to use the default account.

title: Order execution tab
body: Transaction types for bookkeeping

title: Order execution tab
body: For bookkeeping purposes, you can provide transaction types that are used when creating cash transaction for client orders whose settlement date doesn’t follow the default logic.

title: Order execution tab
body: Leave these transaction types empty to use the accounts for cash transactions instead.

title: Client orders
body: Settlement cycle

title: Client orders
body: Setting to define the settlement date for subscriptions and redemptions if it is missing in the client order. Enter the number of days after the transaction date.

title: Client orders

title: Client orders
body: Account used for client transactions created from trade orders.

title: Client orders

title: Client orders

title: Client orders

title: Cash transactions created for the fund
body: Default transaction types

title: Cash transactions created for the fund
body: Transaction types for the cash transactions (unit holder deposits and withdrawals). We recommend using the "Deposit - Fund (FMDEP)" and "Withdrawal - Fund (FMWD)" types.

title: Cash transactions created for the fund
body: Account for cash transactions

title: Cash transactions created for the fund
body: Account number for the cash transactions. Leave the field empty to use the default account.

title: Cash transactions created for the fund
body: Transaction types for bookkeeping

title: Cash transactions created for the fund
body: For bookkeeping purposes, you can provide transaction types that are used when creating cash transaction for client orders whose settlement date doesn’t follow the default logic.

title: Cash transactions created for the fund
body: Leave these transaction types empty to use the accounts for cash transactions instead.

title: Breakdown of cash transactions
body: Breakdown of trade amount in cash transactions.

title: Breakdown of cash transactions
body: Par value (the first NAV value)

title: Breakdown of cash transactions
body: Par value to use in the deposit and withdrawal transactions.

title: Breakdown of cash transactions
body: Par value cost type

title: Breakdown of cash transactions

title: Breakdown of cash transactions

title: Breakdown of cash transactions

title: NAV reporting tab
body: The NAV reporting tab features options for setting up custom NAV reports and sending NAV reports by email.

title: NAV reporting tab
body: NAV report PDF template

title: NAV reporting tab
body: The path to the PDF template used for building NAV reports. The path to the default template is pre-filled for you. To use a custom template, enter the template path in the field. To learn more about configuring custom reports, see Customize the NAV report (XLSX) in FA Developer guide.

title: NAV reporting tab
body: NAV report XLSX template

title: NAV reporting tab
body: The path to the XSLX template used for building NAV reports. The path to the default template is pre-filled for you. To use a custom template, enter the template path in the field. To learn more about configuring custom reports, see Customize the NAV report (XLSX) in FA Developer guide.

title: NAV reporting tab
body: Send report via email

title: NAV reporting tab
body: Enable sending NAV reports by email. You can send NAV reports by email from FA Back (for instructions, see Send documents via email). We recommend that your administrator schedules the report sending in Tools → Administer → Scheduled functions in FA Back. For example, you can have the emails sent out every afternoon on the days when you calculate NAV.

title: NAV reporting tab
body: Recipients

title: NAV reporting tab
body: Emails to send the reports to. Email addresses in this field are automatically added to the "Report via email" list of emails in FA Back, meaning that all other reports that are generated for the fund are sent to this email too.

title: Income distribution tab
body: The Income distribution tab features settings for keeping track of the fund's accrued income and calculating the tax on it if needed. FA Fund Management app calculates the accrued income based on the bookkeeping postings and records the result into your fund every time you calculate NAV. You can choose to calculate tax on the accrued income at the same time.

title: Income distribution tab
body: After NAV is calculated, the system creates transactions for accrued income and calculated tax. The calculation also allocates accrued income per share class in security market data (Security window, Market data tab in FA Back) while pricing the share classes with NAV.

title: Income distribution tab
body: Click Enable income distribution and fill in the fields.

title: Accrued income
body: Settings to calculate accrued income.

title: Accrued income
body: Accrued income formula

title: Accrued income
body: Fee formula to calculate accrued income. Accrued income is calculated every time you calculate NAV. By default, the formula is "Fee formula for income distribution".

title: Accrued income
body: Fee formula can be specified either for the whole fund or for a share class (not for both). Make sure that you don’t have any fee formulas in the Share class wizard, Fee structure tab if you use fund-level rules and the other way round.

title: Accrued income
body: Fee transaction type

title: Accrued income
body: Type of the transaction generated by the accrued income formula. For example, the default fee formula for income distribution used the Icome distribution (ID) transaction type.

title: Accrued income
body: Bookkeeping accounts used to calculate income distribution

title: Accrued income
body: Fields for bookkeeping accounts to track accrued income. When you calculate NAV, FA sums up the balances on the specified bookkeeping accounts on the NAV date. To enter multiple account numbers, separate them with a semicolon. To include only part of the account balance in the calculation, enter a percentage after the account number. For example, "123456=45,5" means that 45,5% of the 123456 account balance is used in the calculation.

title: Accrued income
body: Mark all “Ready” bookkeeping postings from start of the year to the NAV date as “Reported” when NAV is accepted

title: Accrued income
body: Change the status of bookkeeping postings produced by income distribution when the NAV is accepted. In most cases, you need to have this option selected.

title: Accrued tax
body: Settings to calculate tax on accrued income.

title: Accrued tax
body: Calculate tax of the accrued income distribution

title: Accrued tax
body: Option to record tax to be paid on the accrued income. Fill in the tax parameters below.

title: Accrued tax
body: Tax percentage

title: Accrued tax
body: Percentage of accrued income to be paid as tax.

title: Accrued tax
body: Tax formula

title: Accrued tax
body: Fee formula used to calculate tax on accrued income. By default, the formula is "Tax formula for income distribution".

title: Accrued tax
body: Transaction type

title: Accrued tax
body: Type of the transaction generated by the tax formula. For example, the default "Tax formula for income distribution" formula uses the "Accrued tax debt for income (ITX)" transaction type.

title: Accounting tab
body: The Accounting tab lets you define accounts and rules for generating postings for income distribution (for other income distribution settings, see Income distribution tab .

title: Accounting tab
body: Automated deferral runs before NAV calculation

title: Accounting tab
body: Settings for deferral runs before NAV calculation. You need to run deferrals to generate postings for the income distribution calculation.

title: Accounting tab
body: Choose the deferral type to run and the previous deferral date. If the previous deferral date is empty, the starting date of the fund is used.

title: Accounting tab
body: Accounting rules for income distribution-related postings

title: Accounting tab
body: Accounting rules that are used to generate postings related to income distribution. These rules are specified in the system configuration made by FA consultants. Enter them in the Accounting rules for income distribution-related postings field to change posting status to “Reported” when you accept NAV.

title: Advanced settings tab
body: The Advanced settings tab contains miscellaneous settings for your fund.

title: Unit certificates
body: Setting for unit certificates. To learn more about unit certificates in the FA Fund management app, see the Unit certificate

title: Unit certificates
body: Report template (PDF)

title: Unit certificates
body: The path to the custom Unit certificate template. For example, "/UnitCertificateCustom/Unit certificate".

title: Unit certificates
body: Transaction types

title: Unit certificates
body: Transaction types for the unit certificate to show in the Shareholder registry view. If empty, only the UC type is shown.

title: Pricing of share class without shareholders
body: Define how the unit price for newly created share classes with no shareholders is set:

title: Pricing of share class without shareholders
body: Select the checkbox to use the previous price of the share class.

title: Pricing of share class without shareholders
body: Leave the checkbox empty to use the price from the share class with a higher priority.

title: Allocation
body: Define the setting for updating the share class security allocations.

title: Allocation
body: Update fund security allocations automatically when accepting NAV

title: Allocation
body: The option to update allocations for the share class securities when you accept NAV. You can view allocations in the Security window, Allocations tab in FA Back.

title: Allocation
body: Update allocations for securities that get price from share classes

title: Allocation
body: The option to update allocations for securities that get prices from share classes. For example, such structure with multiple securities can be used, if your fund shares are sold via a nominee. In this case, the share class ownership is handled with two securities:

title: Allocation
body: Share class security that is automatically created in FA Back when you add a share class. This security has the nominee as a shareholder.

title: Allocation
body: Security that has the same prices as the share class security and is owned by end clients. This security is used to get share class positions in clients' portfolios. To link this security to the share class security, open it in FA Back and choose the share class security in the Price from security field.

title: Allocation
body: Choose Update allocations for all securities that get price from share classes to have allocations updated for all securities.

title: Allocation
body: Allocation groups

title: Allocation
body: Allocation groups to update share class allocations based on fund portfolio contents when you accept NAV. Allocations are updated for the configured group(s), based on the fund portfolio’s allocations on the NAV date.

title: Basic info tab
body: The Basic info tab contains the basic information about the fund.

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund company*

title: Basic info tab
body: The company the fund is administered by. See Create a fund company.

title: Basic info tab
body: Language*

title: Basic info tab
body: The language to be used in portfolio reports. You can also see the language of the fund in the contact of the company in FA Back.

title: Basic info tab
body: Juridical*

title: Basic info tab
body: Juridical form of the fund company. You can also see the juridical form in the contact of the company in FA Back.

title: Basic info tab
body: Name*

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund name.

title: Basic info tab
body: ID*

title: Basic info tab
body: A unique fund ID used to identify the fund and search for funds. You should only use numbers and letters (a-z).

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund business ID

title: Basic info tab
body: The ID provided by the authorities for your fund. Fund business ID is used for tax reporting purposes. The ID is saved in FA Back. You can find it in the Portfolio window, IDs tab.

title: Basic info tab
body: Inception date*

title: Basic info tab
body: The date when the fund starts.

title: Basic info tab
body: Currency*

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund currency. Once you create a fund, the currency can't be changed.

title: Basic info tab
body: Valuation method*

title: Basic info tab
body: Valuation method for the fund portfolio:

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price with adjustments – Uses transaction types that control the market value of the positions with the transaction's trade amount, such as Private Equity transaction types.

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price with separate items – Valuates portfolio with average price, but keeps track of original purchase dates.

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO (combined) – Valuates the portfolio based directly on transactions in the subportfolios.

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO with adjustments – Uses transaction types that control the market value of the positions with the transaction's trade amount, such as Private Equity transaction types.

title: Basic info tab
body: Type*

title: Basic info tab
body: Portfolio type. Choose the type that corresponds to the fund portfolio.

title: Cash accounts
body: Cash accounts for the fund.

title: Cash accounts
body: Name*

title: Cash accounts
body: Account name.

title: Cash accounts
body: Currency*

title: Cash accounts
body: Account currency.

title: Cash accounts
body: Account number*

title: Cash accounts
body: The account number, for example, the bank account number.

title: Cash accounts
body: Set as default account

title: Cash accounts
body: Set the account as the default account of the portfolio. All transactions are by default created against this account.

title: Cash accounts
body: Set as fee capitalization account

title: Cash accounts
body: Set the account as the cash account for fee capitalization (see Set up a management fee and Set up a performance fee).

title: Cash accounts
body: Share to all parent portfolio's subportfolios

title: Cash accounts
body: Make the account available in the parent portfolio and in the other portfolios under the parent portfolio. Choose this option, for example, if you are going to use FX-hedged share classes in your fund. For details, see Hedge currency exposure.

title: Add share classes
body: A fund in FA Fund Management must have at least one share class. You can add share classes to a newly created fund, as well as to an existing fund that has been operating. To add a share class:

title: Add share classes
body: Go to NAV status view and select the fund.

title: Add share classes
body: Click the Add share class  icon in the Fund details pane on the right. The Share class wizard guides you through the share class properties that you need to define. For details, see Share class properties in the Share class wizard.

title: Add share classes
body: When you create a share class in the Fund Management app, the system creates a security for this share class in FA Back. You can proceed to create initial investments in this security by adding transactions or trade orders in FA Back. See Create initial investments for instructions.

title: Share class properties in the Share class wizard
body: Share class properties in the Share class wizard

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class details and NAV calculation settings.

title: Basic info tab
body: Name*

title: Basic info tab
body: Name of the share class security.

title: Basic info tab
body: Code*

title: Basic info tab
body: A unique code defined for the share class. The code is used to identify the share class security and search for securities in the system. We recommend using numbers and letters (a-z) and avoiding special characters in the security code.

title: Basic info tab
body: ISIN

title: Basic info tab
body: The ISIN code of the share class security.

title: Basic info tab
body: Type*

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class security type. Choose the type that is configured for funds in Preferences. If you have standard solution configuration, use Collective investment vehicles type.

title: Basic info tab
body: Holiday calendar*

title: Basic info tab
body: A holiday calendar that determines business days and holidays in the market to set a settlement date for subscriptions and redemptions. Holiday calendar options are configured in Preferences. You can also set the default holiday calendar used for new securities in Preferences.

title: Share class priority
body: Share class priority

title: Share class priority
body: The order in which share class NAVs are calculated if there are multiple share classes. The NAV for the share class with the highest priority is calculated first.

title: Decimals in transaction units
body: Number of decimals

title: Decimals in transaction units
body: Number of decimals used in the units field of the client transactions. If the field is empty, the number of decimals set for the security type is used.

title: Dividend payments
body: Enable dividend payments

title: Dividend payments
body: Enable dividend payments for the share class. You can calculate and execute dividends in the Dividends view. For details, see Pay out fund dividends.

title: NAV tab
body: Unit price settings.

title: NAV tab
body: Currency

title: NAV tab
body: Share class currency – the currency share class units are quoted in.

title: NAV tab
body: Initial price*

title: NAV tab
body: Initial price of the share class unit. Initial unit price is used for the first NAV calculation. The price you enter is copied to the Market data info tab in the Security window in FA Back.

title: NAV tab
body: Date of initial price*

title: NAV tab
body: (Set for a new share class). The date for which the initial unit price is valid.

title: NAV tab
body: Format

title: NAV tab
body: Unit price multipliers to use in calculations. For more information about multipliers, see the description of the Basic info tab in the Security window. Choose one of the options:

title: NAV tab
body: Show price as is – Show the share class unit price without any multipliers.

title: NAV tab
body: In percentage – Use "100" in both Multiplier fields for the security.

title: NAV tab
body: Add manually – Enter the multipliers in the fields below.

title: Decimals for share class NAV
body: Number of decimals*

title: Decimals for share class NAV
body: The number of decimals used in the share class NAV. Enter "1" or more. If the value is "0", NAV is stored with 10 decimals.

title: Fee structure tab
body: The Fee structure tab defines fees applied on the share class level, for example, a performance fee. Share class-specific fees are calculated after the fund level fees, in the order you entered them in the Share class wizard. For details about setting up fees, see Handle fund fees.

title: Ongoing fees
body: Ongoing fees

title: Ongoing fees
body: Click Add fee and enter the information about the share class fees:

title: Ongoing fees
body: Fee formula

title: Ongoing fees
body: Fee formula used to calculate the fee and generate fee transaction.

title: Ongoing fees
body: Fee transaction type

title: Ongoing fees
body: Transaction type linked to the chosen fee formula (filled in automatically once you choose the fee formula).

title: Ongoing fees
body: Amount or %

title: Ongoing fees
body: Fee percentage or amount in the fund currency, depending on the fee formula.

title: Ongoing fees
body: Decimals

title: Ongoing fees
body: The number of decimals used for calculating fees (0 to 10). The “Default” value is 2 decimals.

title: Ongoing fees
body: Ex-post cost category

title: Ongoing fees
body: Ex-post cost category for the fee. The categorization is used in cost analysis and reporting (see View ex-post costs and charges in FA User guide), as well as for creating kickbacks (see Rebate contracts (kickbacks) in FA User guide).

title: Ongoing fees
body: Account currency

title: Ongoing fees
body: The currency of the share class fee accrual account. Choose if the fees should be accrued in the fund currency or in the share class currency. The field is shown only if the share class currency is different from the fund currency.

title: Ongoing fees
body: Additional options

title: Ongoing fees
body: Additional fee setups.

title: Ongoing fees
body: Formula sets the transaction account

title: Ongoing fees
body: Set an account for the fee formula. For example, this can be useful with accrued account interest transactions over multiple accounts.

title: Ongoing fees
body: Include in income distribution

title: Ongoing fees
body: Include the fee in the income distribution calculation.

title: Ongoing fees
body: Use crystallization schedule for capitalization

title: Ongoing fees
body: Capitalize fees automatically on the crystallization date when you accept NAV. The crystallization dates are defined in the Fee crystallization schedule (Fund wizard, Schedules tab). Fees are capitalized to the account that has “Fee capitalization” tag. If no account is marked with this tag, fees are capitalized to the default cash account.

title: Performance fee settings
body: The Performance fee settings section contains the performance fee parameters. You can see this section if you add a performance fee in the Ongoing fees section above.

title: Performance fee settings
body: Hurdle rate

title: Performance fee settings
body: Hurdle rate – the minimum NAV increase above the high-water mark starting from which the performance fee is accrued.

title: Performance fee settings
body: High-water mark

title: Performance fee settings
body: High-water mark (the highest NAV for the share class).

title: Performance fee settings
body: High-water mark date

title: Performance fee settings
body: The date on which the high-water mark level was set.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The Performance fee equalization section contains parameters to calculate and equalize performance fee. Choose the fee parameters. Then, define the crystallization schedule in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab, and the fee formula in the Fund wizard, Fee structure tab.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee percentage

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee percentage to calculate the fee amount.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Hurdle rate

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The minimum NAV increase above HWM starting from which the performance fee is paid.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Day count

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Day count convention to use in performance fee calculation with hurdle rate. If the calculation period is less than a year, the hurdle rate is adjusted proportionally using the day count convention you chose.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: High-water mark

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The initial high water mark (HWM) to use for the performance fee calculation. Usually, HWM is set to the highest NAV value in the share class. On the crystallization date, FA Fund Management compares the share class NAV to the HWM. If NAV is higher than HWM, the HWM value is updated to the current NAV value.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: High-water mark date

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The date on which high-water mark is set.

title: Transaction fees
body: The Transaction fees section contains parameters for subscription and redemption fees and charging them automatically when you calculate NAV. To learn more about setting up transaction fees, see Transaction fees for a fund.

title: Transaction fees
body: Enter the subscription and redemption fee parameters:

title: Transaction fees
body: Calculate fee for net trade amount-based subscriptions

title: Transaction fees
body: The amount from which the subscription fee is calculated in net trade amount-based trade orders: order trade amount or the sum invested in the fund.

title: Transaction fees
body: Define default transaction fees

title: Transaction fees
body: Settings for subscription and redemption fees calculated automatically in the share class currency and included in the transaction.

title: Transaction fees
body: Cost percentage

title: Transaction fees
body: Fee percentage to calculate the fee amount.

title: Transaction fees
body: To set the fee as a fixed amount per transaction, enter "0" as a cost percentage and then specify the fee amount in the Minimum field.

title: Transaction fees
body: Minimum

title: Transaction fees
body: The minimum fee amount to charge.

title: Cash transactions tab
body: Account settings to handle deposits and withdrawals.

title: Cash transactions tab
body: Account

title: Cash transactions tab
body: A fund portfolio account to record deposits and withdrawals to. If the field is empty, the account in the fund settings or the default account is used.

title: FX hedging tab
body: FX hedging settings to apply if your share class currency is different from the fund currency and you want to use FX hedging to neutralize the effect of the exchange rate. Click Enable FX hedging and fill in the fields. For full instruction on how to set up and manage FX-hedged share classes, see Hedge currency exposure in FA User guide.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Formula

title: FX hedging tab
body: The formula for the FX hedge accrual. You can choose the "FX hedge formula" that comes pre-configured in Standard solution.

title: FX hedging tab
body: FX hedge transaction type

title: FX hedging tab
body: Transaction type linked to the FX hedging formula.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Hedge parent portfolio

title: FX hedging tab
body: ID and portfolio type of the hedge parent portfolio that links fund and hedge portfolios in FA Back. The hedge parent portfolio is empty. It is used to group the fund and hedge portfolios and share accounts between them. You can edit the hedge parent portfolio properties only when you enable hedging for one of the fund share classes for the first time. After that, hedge parent portfolio is set and can't be edited.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Hedge portfolio

title: FX hedging tab
body: ID and portfolio type of the hedge portfolio that contains FX contracts in FA Back. You can edit the hedge portfolio properties only when you enable hedging for a share class. After that, the hedge portfolio is set and can't be edited.

title: Create initial investments
body: After you set up share classes, you can add initial investments. You can choose how you enter them in the system:

title: Create initial investments
body: Add investments as trade orders. Collect initial subscriptions as trade orders before your fund or your new share class starts operating.

title: Create initial investments
body: Add investments as transactions.

title: Create initial investments
body: If you are adding a share class in a fund that already operates and has share classes, the process of creating initial investments is similar: you need to create subscriptions (as trade orders or as transactions) but you don't need to start the fund. Skip this step – the new share class subscriptions will be included in the NAV calculation on the initial date specified in the share class settings.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: To handle initial investments as trade orders:

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Create trade orders in FA Back. Go to New → New trade order → Collective investment vehicles in FA Back and fill in the fields:

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Portfolio – Portfolio of the client who subscribes to the fund.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Security – Fund share class.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Account – The account from which the payment is made.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Transaction date, Settlement date – Transaction date and settlement date. These dates must be later than the date of the initial price you set for the share class.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Transaction type – Transaction type: Subscription (SUB).

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Unit price – Share class until price. Enter "1" – when the trade order is executed, the unit price is updated automatically based on the share class settings.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Trade amount – Subscription trade amount.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: On the fund or share class inception date, before you start the fund or calculate NAV, make sure that:

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: The trade orders are in the Executable status.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: The relevant transaction fee is set for subscriptions in the Share class settings. For example, you can execute first fund subscriptions without a transaction fee and add it later in the share class settings if needed.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Start the fund on the fund inception date. Choose the fund in the NAV status view and click Start fund in the Fund details pane on the right. As a result, FA Fund Management:

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Executes subscription trade orders up to the fund inception date with the initial price defined in the Share class wizard.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Adds the fund units in the shareholders' portfolios.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Creates a consolidated deposit transaction (FMDEP) to the fund portfolio.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: Skip this step if you added a share class in an existing fund. FA Fund Management will complete the above actions automatically when you accept NAV on the share class initial price date.

title: Add investments as trade orders
body: You have now created initial investments in the new share class. On the NAV date, you can proceed with the regular NAV calculation and acceptance workflow: Calculate and accept NAV.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: To handle initial investments as transactions:

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Create transactions. Go to New → New transaction → Collective investment vehicles in FA Back and fill in the fields:

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Portfolio – Portfolio of the client who subscribes to the fund.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Security – Fund share class.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Account – The account from which the payment is made.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Transaction date, Settlement date – Transaction date and settlement date. These dates must be later than the date of the initial price you set for the share class.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Transaction type – Transaction type: Subscription (SUB).

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Amount – The number of fund units.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Unit price – Share class until price. Enter "?" to fetch the price that you set in the Share class wizard. You can leave the field empty (the price is filled in automatically based on the share class settings).

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Status – Accepted.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: When you save the transaction, the system adds the fund units in the shareholders' portfolios.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Start the fund on the fund inception date. Choose the fund in the NAV status view and click Start fund in the Fund details pane on the right.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Skip this step if you added a share class in an existing fund.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Create a consolidated deposit transaction (FMDEP) to the fund portfolio. The transaction amount will be included in the first NAV calculation. Right-click the fund portfolio in the portfolio hierarchy in FA Back and choose New transaction → Collective investment vehicles. Fill in the fields:

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Portfolio – Fund portfolio.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Security - Fund share class.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Transaction type – Transaction type: Depost - Fund (FMDEP).

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Transaction date and Settlement date – Transaction date and settlement date must be the same as in the subscription transactions.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Amount – Total sum received from subscriptions you created.

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Unit price – "1".

title: Add investments as transactions
body: Status – Transaction status: "Accepted".

title: Add investments as transactions
body: You have now created initial investments in the new share class. On the NAV date, you can proceed with the regular NAV calculation and acceptance workflow: Calculate and accept NAV.

title: Create fund groups
body: Fund groups help you handle your funds: you can set up groups and select a group of funds to work with in the NAV status view, or calculate NAV for the funds in a certain group. For example, you can group funds managed or calculated by a certain employee or funds in different geographical areas, such as Europe and Asia. Fund groups can be useful if you have a fund of funds and want to calculate NAV for them in the needed order.

title: Create fund groups
body: Fund groups are static (based on a list of funds) or dynamic (based on certain criteria). Dynamic groups are created in FA Back. Editing a dynamic group in FA Fund management is limited.

title: Create fund groups
body: To view fund groups, click in the NAV status view and open Fund groups. To see what groups a fund belongs to, open the Fund groups overview tab. You can download the list as a CSV or XLSX file or print it by clicking Export.

title: Create static fund groups
body: To create a static fund group, do the following:

title: Create static fund groups
body: Go to the NAV status view, click in the top right and select Fund groups.

title: Create static fund groups
body: Click Add fund group and fill in the fields:

title: Create static fund groups
body: Group name*

title: Create static fund groups
body: The name of the fund group.

title: Create static fund groups
body: Group code*

title: Create static fund groups
body: A code to identify the group and distinguish it from others. The group code for fund groups starts with "FAFUNDS_".

title: Create static fund groups
body: Description

title: Create static fund groups
body: An optional detailed description of the fund group.

title: Create static fund groups
body: Select funds in All funds and click Add to group to include them in the fund group. To remove funds, click Remove from group.

title: Create static fund groups
body: Click Save.

title: Create or edit dynamic fund groups
body: Dynamic fund groups cannot be created or edited in FA Fund Management directly. You can create a dynamic group in FA Back, and the group code prefix must be "FAFUNDS_". For details, see Groups view in FA Back reference.

title: Create or edit dynamic fund groups
body: If you need to edit a dynamic group without accessing FA Back, you can copy this group as a static group and edit the copy instead. To use this workaround, click and then Copy fund group in the group details in FA Fund Management.

title: View funds and share classes
body: The NAV overview shows the list of your funds with key information, NAV status and dates, and outstanding trade orders.

title: View the list of funds
body: The list of funds shows your funds and their share classes in a tree structure. For the list of columns, see Fund and share class information.

title: View the list of funds
body: To view a fund group, choose one in the Select a fund group dropdown. The dropdown shows fund groups that have a code with the prefix "FAFUNDS_" (see Create fund groups in FA Back reference). You can see fund share classes under each fund in the list.

title: View fund details
body: To view the fund details, click the fund in the list and open the Fund details pane on the right. You can see:

title: View fund details
body: Basic info: fund ID and fund currency.

title: View fund details
body: NAV information: NAV status, next NAV date, who and when calculated and accepted the current NAV. If the NAV acceptance is in progress, you can view the details by clicking View progress.

title: View fund details
body: Orders: outstanding trade orders per share class affecting the next NAV calculation.

title: View fund details
body: For details about each field, see Fund and share class information.

title: View fund details
body: You can open the fund portfolio in FA Back by clicking View in FA Back .

title: View share class details
body: To view share class details, click on a share class in the list. In the Share class details pane, you can see the following information:

title: View share class details
body: Basic info: share class security information (Code, ISIN code, Currency), NAV data (Latest NAV as well as the NAV overview graph) and high-water mark information (if applicable).

title: View share class details
body: Orders: outstanding trade orders for the share class affecting the next NAV calculation.

title: View share class details
body: For the field descriptions, see Fund and share class information.

title: View share class details
body: You can open the share class security in FA Back by clicking View in FA Back .

title: Fund and share class information
body: ID

title: Fund and share class information
body: Portfolio ID for funds and Security code for share classes.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Status

title: Fund and share class information
body: NAV calculation status that indicates if you should calculate NAV for the fund today. Learn more about the statuses in the Workflows and NAV statuses section. NAV statuses are shown for the current date and time, displayed above the funds list. If the date and time aren’t current, refresh the page by clicking the refresh icon at the top-right corner to view the recent information.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Error

title: Fund and share class information
body: Errors in NAV calculation and acceptance. If there are any errors, you can see the icon next to the fund status. To view the errors, hover the mouse over the icon. To find out the error details, go to the audit log in the Fund details pane on the right.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Next NAV

title: Fund and share class information
body: The date for which you should calculate and accept NAV next. NAV date may differ from the calculation date – the date when you should do the calculation.

title: Fund and share class information
body: For example, you might calculate NAV for the last day of the month (for example, 31.1) on the first day of the next month (for example, 1.2). When you log in on 1.2 your fund status would be “pending NAV”, but the next NAV date would show 31.1.

title: Fund and share class information
body: The date switches to the next one in the schedule as soon as you accept the calculated NAV.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Latest NAV

title: Fund and share class information
body: The latest date for which you calculated and accepted NAV. You can see the corresponding NAV values on the share class level in the list.

title: Fund and share class information
body: NAV value

title: Fund and share class information
body: The latest calculated NAV value.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Order count, Total count

title: Fund and share class information
body: The number of outstanding trade orders on the fund level and for each share class. The number is based on the trade orders marked as executable in FA Back. To learn more about entering trade orders for the fund, see FA Back.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Order value, Total value

title: Fund and share class information
body: The value of outstanding trade orders. The calculation depends on how the trade order was entered in FA Back:

title: Fund and share class information
body: If the trade orders are based on the trade amount, Order value shows total net value. It is shown on the share class level and on the fund level, if all fund share classes are in the same currency.

title: Fund and share class information
body: If the trade orders are based on the number of units, Order value shows total number estimated with latest NAV: Order_value=Number_of_units⋅Latest_NAVOrder_value=Number_of_units\cdotLatest_NAV

title: Questions about fund and share class information shown in the NAV overview
body: I set a share class status "passive" in FA Back. Why is it still shown in the funds list?

title: Questions about fund and share class information shown in the NAV overview
body: The list shows all fund’s share classes, regardless, for example, of their status.

title: Questions about fund and share class information shown in the NAV overview
body: I can't see the fund group selection. Why?

title: Questions about fund and share class information shown in the NAV overview
body: This means that you have only one group defined in FA Back or that you have permissions to view only one group of funds.

title: View the fund portfolio
body: The fund portfolio is managed in FA Back, but you can view the portfolio positions in the FA Fund management app. To do this, double-click the fund in the NAV status view and choose the Portfolio tab. Amounts are shown in the fund currency ("pf") or share class currency ("sec").

title: View the fund portfolio
body: By default, the table includes the columns listed in Portfolio position information in the NAV window below. To change which columns are shown, click Columns.

title: View the fund portfolio
body: The column values are based on the current day. Some values may not be meaningful when viewed for a single day.

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: The Portfolio tab in the NAV window shows the following information about the fund portfolio positions.

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Security

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: List of positions in your portfolio shown as a position’s security name or an account name.

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Units

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Number of units or account balance.

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Market unit price (pf)

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Market unit price in portfolio currency.

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Market price date

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: The date for which the market unit price is fetched.

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Change %

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Unit price change since last NAV calculation as a percentage.

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Market value (pf, clean)

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Market value of the position excluding accrued interest.

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Accrued interest

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Accrued interest for the position.

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Market value (pf, dirty)

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Market value of the position including accrued interest, in portfolio currency.

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: Currency (sec)

title: Portfolio position information in the NAV window
body: The currency of the position security.

title: View fund shareholders
body: The Shareholder registry view shows information about shareholders and their ownership in the fund.

title: View the list of shareholders
body: You can view the list of shareholders and their ownership in the fund as a tree structure. Expand the shareholder name to view share classes to which the shareholder has ownership. To view the purchase lots for each shareholder in the list, select the Load purchase lots checkbox. This shows the whole history of purchase lots, including the ones not held anymore.

title: View the list of shareholders
body: To view shareholders for a fund, select a fund in the Select a fund dropdown. The list shows funds in groups with the code prefix “FAFUNDS_” (see Groups view in FA Back reference).

title: View the list of shareholders
body: To view fund shareholders for a previous date, change the date in Registry date.

title: View shareholder details
body: To view details for a shareholder, click on a row in the list. In the side pane that opens, you can see the following sections:

title: View shareholder details
body: Info: Shows the shareholder's contact ID, juridical form, tax country, and address information.

title: View shareholder details
body: Unit certificates: Shows the number of units acquired in each share class by purchase lots and the unit certificates issued for the shareholder (marked with "UC"). You can create, download, and delete unit certificates (see Unit certificate).

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Shareholder

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: The top level shows name of the shareholder. Lower levels show share classes the shareholder owns and date of the open purchase lots within each share class (the individual purchases the shareholder made into the share class). Purchase lots under each share class are ordered from oldest to newest according to FIFO (based on purchase lot date or the order they appear in during the same date).

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Share class name.

body: Total ownership
