title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Unit certificates

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: A unit certificate states the number of fund or share class units owned by a shareholder. It may cover all units owned by the shareholder or a part of them. A unit certificate can be used if a shareholder wants to, for example, pledge their shares as collateral for a loan.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Units

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Shown on the share class, unit certificates, and purchase lot levels. The number of units the shareholder owns in a share class or units purchased in a specific purchase lot.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Market value

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: The market value of the position from the selected date. If the market value is not available for this date, the previous date is used.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Purchase value

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: The purchase value of the position or purchase lot in the share class currency.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Currency

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: The currency of the share class.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Change (amount)

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: The difference between the Purchase value and Market value columns in the share class currency.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Purchase lot ID

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Shown on the purchase lot level. The purchase lot ID (based on the order the purchase lots were created) or the unit certificate ID (starting with "UC").

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Purchase date

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: The date the purchase lot was purchased.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Contact ID

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: The customer’s contact ID stored in FA Back. This is a unique ID of the shareholder, such as a social security number.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: The details stored in the customer’s contact in FA Back. If the customer information contains multiple addresses, the shareholder registry shows the first address defined in the contact in FA Back.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Juridical form

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Classifications stored under "juridical form" in the contact in FA Back. Juridical form is often used to differentiate between private persons and companies.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Tax country

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: The tax country specified for the shareholder's contact in FA Back. The tax country often indicates where the shareholder pays taxes. In the FA Platform, this is also used to calculate taxes.

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: Change (%)

title: Shareholder information in the Shareholder registry
body: The difference between the Purchase value and Market value columns as a percentage.

title: View fund orders
body: The Orders view shows information about trade orders for funds, including fund subscriptions and redemptions.

title: View fund orders
body: SCREENSHOT OF VIEW HERE

title: View the list of orders
body: You can view the fund orders as a list. The fund orders are filtered based on the selected transaction date. You can choose a predefined transaction date period (today, previous 7 days, previous month, previous quarter) or select specific dates.

title: View the list of orders
body: You can save the fund order list as a view and open it again later by clicking . To manage saved views, click .

title: View order details
body: To view details for a fund order, click on a row in the list. In the side pane that opens, you can see the following information:

title: View order details
body: Fund order details: Shows the same information as the fund order list columns and the fund order execution method and reference.

title: View order details
body: Documents: Shows documents uploaded for the order, the tags applied to them, and the date and time they were last modified. You can download the documents to your computer.

title: Handle fund fees
body: FA Fund Management lets you handle fees:

title: Handle fund fees
body: Ongoing fees, such as management or performance fee, are calculated throughout the period and capitalized at the end of the period by transferring the fee amount from the cash account marked for capitalization to the accrued fee account. Ongoing fees are calculated based on the fund's NAV or fee calculation schedule. They can be set up per share class or for the whole fund. For details, see Ongoing fees.

title: Handle fund fees
body: Transaction fees on subscriptions and redemptions can be included in the fund orders automatically. Specify the fee percentage in the share class settings. For details, see Transaction fees for a fund.

title: Ongoing fees
body: FA Fund management helps you keep track of the fund's ongoing fees and capitalize them at the end of the period. You can schedule fee calculations and fee capitalization according to your business flow.

title: Calculating ongoing fees
body: Depending on your business needs, you can calculate ongoing fees as a part or NAV calculation, or set up a separate schedule to calculate ongoing fees between the NAV dates as well. Also, fees can be calculated ad-hoc.

title: Ongoing fees within NAV calculation
body: Ongoing fees are calculated when you calculate NAV. When you accept NAV, fees are accrued on a separate accrual account. The details of this workflow are described in Workflows and NAV statuses.

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: You can calculate and accrue fees between the regular NAV dates, using a separate schedule for fee calculation. For example, if your fund calculates NAV once a month, you can still schedule unofficial fee updates once a week to get intermediate fees.

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: If you set a separate schedule for calculating and accepting fees, your fund shows fee statuses to help you keep track of your fee calculation cycle and calculate fees on time.

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: The statuses for the fee calculation workflow are:

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: No action

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: No action needs to be taken today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: Pending fees

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: Fees need to be calculated today. If you didn’t calculate fees for the previous scheduled days, you need to calculate and accept them first to be able to calculate the current day’s fees.

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: Fees calculated

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: Fees were already calculated today.

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: Warning

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: Fees were calculated today with warnings that might need your attention.

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: Fees rejected

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: Fee calculation result was rejected by the user. Fees need to be calculated again today.

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: Fees accepted

title: Separate schedule for ongoing fees
body: Fee calculation result was accepted.

title: Non-scheduled fee calculations
body: You can calculate and accept fees outside the schedule, if this is required by your business process. To turn on this feature, allow non-scheduled calculations in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab (see Create a fund).

title: Capitalizing accrued fees
body: Fee capitalization can be done at any interval, depending on your fund's rules and practices. You can capitalize fees automatically according to the fee capitalization schedule or create a transaction yourself.

title: Capitalizing accrued fees
body: To capitalize the accrued fees, transfer the fee amount from the cash account marked for capitalization to the accrued fee account. The fee account balance then becomes zero.

body: Example: The yearly fixed fee amount is 365 EUR. We use the "ACT/ACT ISDA" day count convention and calculate the fee from 4 March to 6 March 2023. The fee is 365 EUR/ 365 days * 3 days = 3 EUR.

title: Define the fee parameters
body: The next step is to include the fee in your fund's fee structure. You can apply the fixed fee on the fund or on the share class level. Fund-level fees are applied to all share classes. They are calculated first, in the order you place them in the fund settings, followed by the share class fees.

title: Define the fee parameters
body: To define the fee parameters:

title: Define the fee parameters
body: In the fund settings:

title: Define the fee parameters
body: Set the fee capitalization account for the fund in the Basic info tab. Enable Set as fee capitalization account for the cash account you want to use for fee capitalization. You can only set one account for fee capitalization per fund. If you do not set a fee capitalization account, the system uses the account you marked as the default account in the Basic info tab.

title: Define the fee parameters
body: (Optional) If you want to use a separate schedule for calculating fees ( see Ongoing fees for details), set it up in the Schedules tab.

title: Define the fee parameters
body: Define the fee crystallization schedule in the Schedules tab. For details about schedule settings, see Create a fund.

title: Define the fee parameters
body: Add the fee on the fund or share class level. Open the Fee structure tab in the fund or share class settings, add the fee formula, percentage and other parameters (for details about fee parameters, see Create a fund and Add share classes). Select Use crystallization schedule for capitalization in Additional options.

title: Define the fee parameters
body: After you set up the fee calculation and capitalization, FA Fund Management creates accrued fee transactions every time you calculate NAV. On the fee capitalization date, the fee amount is transferred from the cash account to the accrued fees account when you accept NAV.

title: Set up a management fee
body: A management fee is based on the average NAV of the fund over the period. The average NAV is calculated based on daily values. To calculate the number of days in the period, FA Fund Management uses the holiday calendar that you define for the fund in the fund settings.

title: Set up a management fee
body: Example: The yearly management fee is 0,1%. The fund's NAV is 365 000 EUR during the calculation period from Saturday, 4 March 2023 to Monday, 6 March 2023. The used day count convention is "ACT/ACT ISDA" and the selected holiday calendar is "Saturday/Sunday weekends". The calculated fee is 365 000 EUR * 0,1% / 365 days * 1 day = 1 EUR. If we change the holiday calendar to "No holidays/weekends", the fee is calculated for all three days and amounts to 3 EUR.

title: Set up a performance fee
body: A performance fee is calculated based on the fund return. For each day in the calculation period, the NAV increase is compared to a threshold (benchmark, hurdle rate, or index), and the difference is multiplied by the fee percentage. The daily fees are summed to get the total amount.
